name: Birch and Swinnerton-Dyer conjecture
rephrased: The conjecture states that the depth to which an elliptic curve's L-function dips to zero at the central point s=1 determines how many 'directions' exist for finding rational solutions on the curve.
implication_form: If the L-function of an elliptic curve has a zero of order r at s=1, then the curve has a rank of r (i.e., r independent rational solutions).
